evs.metric.metrics
Class Metric

java.lang.Object
  evs.metric.metrics.Metric
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Correlation, DiagramMetric, MeanAbsoluteError, MeanError, RawMetric, RelativeMeanError, RootMeanSquareError, SampleSize, ScoreMetric, ThresholdMetricStore
public abstract class Metric
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

An abstract base class for verification metrics. A single metric may store verification results for multiple forecast types, including MetricResult.REGULAR_FORECAST, MetricResult.CLIMATOLOGICAL_FORECAST and MetricResult.PERSISTENCE_FORECAST.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

name

protected java.lang.String name
Name of the metric.

results

protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,MetricResultByLeadTime> results
A store containing a metric result for one or more forecast types. The metric result is stored in a wrapper class of type evs.metric.MetricResultByLeadTime, which stores a metric result for each lead time. See the MetricResult class for forecast type identifiers.

counts

protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,MetricResultByLeadTime> counts
Store of sample counts by forecast type for the last computation.

lastCount

protected int lastCount
Sample count for the current calculation.

descriptionURL

protected java.net.URL descriptionURL
A URL to a description of the metric.

pars

protected MetricParameter[] pars
The parameter values of the metric.

deepCopy

public abstract Metric deepCopy()
Returns a deep copy of the current metric, where all instance variables occupy independent positions in memory from the current metric. Results are also deep copied. See deepCopyResults(evs.metric.metrics.Metric)

Returns:
a deep copy of the current object

isBootstrap

public boolean isBootstrap()
Convenience method that returns true if the following two conditions are met: 1) the implementing class extends BootstrapableMetric OR is a metric store that comprises metrics that extend this class, and; 2) the bootstrapable metric or store of metrics has a bootstrap parameter with a technique identifier other than BootstrapableMetric.NO_BOOTSTRAP.

Returns:
true if the bootstrap parameter has been set

isSkillMetric

public boolean isSkillMetric()
Convenience method that returns true if the implementing class extends SkillScore OR if a metric store comprises metrics that extend this class.

Returns:
true if the metric is a skill score

public boolean isDiscreteMetric()
Returns true if the metric is defined for discrete events, false otherwise.

getDefaultMetric

public static Metric getDefaultMetric()
Returns a metric with default parameter values. This method should be hidden in the concrete subclasses AND called from there, otherwise the current method will return null. This is simply a reminder to hide the static method in the concrete subclass.

Returns:
a metric with default parameter values.

                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,

aggregate

public static Metric aggregate(Metric[] metrics,
                               VectorFunction func,
                               double[] weights)
                        throws MetricCalculationException
Aggregates a set of metrics using the specified function and returns the aggregated metric. Throws an exception if more than one type of metric is provided or the metric parameters are different. The results are aggregated by lead period. Specify a set of weights to use in the aggregation. The weights are constant cross all lead times.

Parameters:
metrics - the input metrics
func - the aggregation function
weights - the weights assigned to each input
Returns:
the aggregated metric
Throws:
MetricCalculationException

getSampleCounts

public MetricResultByLeadTime getSampleCounts(int forecastType)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the number of samples (forecast-observation pairs) associated with the threshold metric or NONE_DEFINED, ordered by lead time, for the specified forecast type. Throws an exception if the samples are unavailable. Call hasSampleCounts(int) first.

Parameters:
forecastType - the forecast type
Returns:
the sample count
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getResult

public MetricResultByLeadTime getResult(int forecastType)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a metric result of a specified type or null if the metric result is undefined for that type (i.e. must be recomputed). If the type is unrecognized, throw an IllegalArgumentException. Call hasResult(forecastType) to establish whether a result exists for a given forecast type.

Parameters:
forecastType - the type of result required (see the ForecastTypeParameter class)
Returns:
the metric result or null
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

willVoidResult

public boolean willVoidResult(MetricParameter[] pars)
Returns true if the specified parameters will void a current result if used to replace the existing parameters. A result will be void if it exists, the input parameters are valid and differ from the current parameters. Currently, this method checks for the presence of any results, rather than results for a specific forecast type.

Returns:
true if a result will be void by the specified parameters

willIgnoreConditions

public boolean willIgnoreConditions()
Returns true if conditions on the pairs will be ignored, false to use the conditional pairs if available.

Returns:
true if conditions on the pairs will be ignored.

hasThresholds

public boolean hasThresholds()
Convenience method that returns true of the metric has dichotomous thresholds associated with it, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the metric has dichotomous thresholds associated with it

willCompute

public boolean willCompute(int forecastType)
Returns true if the metric has a parameter value that indicates the specified result WILL be computed, regardless of whether it is currently available. If so, the result will become available on next calling compute(). See the ForecastTypeParameter class for available types.

Returns:
true if a parameter value indicates the specified result will be computed

compute

public abstract MetricResult[] compute(int forecastType,
                                       PairedData paired,
                                       MetricResult refResult)
                                throws MetricCalculationException
Uses the specified paired data to compute and return the result of the metric. The metric results are returned, together with the sample counts, but are not stored locally. The metric result is located in the first index of the returned array and the sample counts are located in the second index. Optionally, specify the results of a reference forecast from which to compute skill if the metric is a skill score.

Parameters:
forecastType - the forecast type
paired - the paired data
refResult - the results for a reference forecast (may be null)
Returns:
the metric result and sample counts
Throws:
MetricCalculationException

computeByLeadTime

public MetricResultByLeadTime computeByLeadTime(int forecastType,
                                                PairedData paired,
                                                MetricResultByLeadTime reference,
                                                boolean silent)
                                         throws MetricCalculationException
Uses the specified paired data to compute and store the result of the metric for every forecast lead time in the input paired dataset. This method will overwrite the results of a previous calculation if one exists. It also assumes that all conditioning of the forecasts and observations has been completed. Care should be taken to call this method each time the parameter values of the current metric are modified. The metric result is computed for each lead period separately. They are added to the local store with the associated sample counts, both of which are returned for convenience. If the current metric is a skill score, the reference forecast must be provided, unless the reference is sample climatology, otherwise an exception will be thrown. Only one reference forecast is currently supported, but this may be changed in future.

Parameters:
forecastType - the forecast type
paired - the paired data
reference - the reference forecast (may be null, unless skill metric)
silent - is true to silence printing of messages to standard out
Returns:
the result
Throws:
MetricCalculationException

setParameters

public void setParameters(MetricParameter[] pars)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the parameters of the verification metric. If the input parameter values imply that a metric must be recomputed for a given forecast type, the existing result is removed from the result list and any reference to a result file is removed. Call willVoidResult(pars) to establish if an existing result will be voided by a change. Throws an exception if the parameters are inconsistent with the metric.

Parameters:
pars - the parameters
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

setResult

public void setResult(int forecastType,
                      MetricResultByLeadTime result)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets a metric result of a specified type, replacing any existing result. Throws an exception if the result is of an unexpected type or the forecast type is unrecognized.

Parameters:
forecastType - the type of result (see the ForecastTypeParameter class)
result - the metric result to set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

setResults

public void setResults(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,MetricResultByLeadTime> results,
                       java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,MetricResultByLeadTime> counts)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the metric results for specified result types, replacing any existing result. Throws an exception if the result is of an unexpected type or the forecast type is unrecognized.

Parameters:
results - the results
counts - the sample counts (may be null)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the sample counts for existing metric results. Throws an exception if the metadata is of an unexpected type or the forecast type is unrecognized.

Parameters:

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

clearResults

public boolean clearResults(int type)
Clears results for a specified forecast type. Returns true if some results were cleared, false otherwise.

Parameters:
type - the forecast type
Returns:
true if results were cleared, false otherwise

setRefFcst

public void setRefFcst(java.lang.String refID)
Convenience method for setting the reference forecast identifier of a skill metric (e.g. when the verification unit has changed name). Throws an exception if the input ID is null or this is not a skill metric.

Parameters:
refID - the reference forecast identifier

deepCopyResults

protected void deepCopyResults(Metric metric)
Convenience method for deep copying the results associated with the current metric to the input metric.

Parameters:
metric - the input metric that will receive the deep copied results

getSCount

protected int[] getSCount(int forecastType)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the number of samples (forecast-observation pairs) associated with the metric, ordered by lead time, for the specified forecast type. Throws an exception if the samples are unavailable. Call hasSampleCounts(int) first.

Parameters:
forecastType - the forecast type
Returns:
the sample count
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getForecastStatFromPaired

protected DoubleMatrix2D getForecastStatFromPaired(VectorFunction forecastStat,
                                                   DoubleMatrix2D pairs,
                                                   double nV)
Convenience method that computes a statistic from forecast values when the paired input comprise more than one forecast per pair. If not, the input is simply returned.

Parameters:
forecastStat - the forecast statistic
pairs - the paired input
nV - the null value
Returns:
the processed input

getConditionalPairs

protected DoubleMatrix2D getConditionalPairs(DoubleProcedure condition,
                                             DoubleMatrix2D pairs)
                                      throws MetricCalculationException
Returns a set of pairs for which a threshold condition on the observations is met. The condition should be in real-valued units. Throws an exception if no pairs were found that meet the condition.

Parameters:
condition - the condition
Returns:
the conditioned pairs
Throws:
MetricCalculationException

getPar

protected MetricParameter getPar(int type)
Locates and returns a parameter or null if the parameter does not exist.

Parameters:
type - the parameter ID
Returns:
the parameter
